info.title: DisplaySettings API
info.description: The `DisplaySetting` plugin provides an interface for display information such as current video resolution, supported video displays, zoom setting, sound mode, and much more.

audioDelay.summary: Delay (in ms) on the selected audio port

audioDelayOffset.summary: Delay offset (in ms) on the selected audio port

supportedAudioFormat.summary: A list of supported audio formats

items.example: `NONE`, `PCM`, `DOLBY AC3`, `DOLBY EAC3`, `DOLBY AC4`, `DOLBY MAT', 'DOLBY TRUEHD', 'DOLBY EAC3 ATMOS', 'DOLBY TRUEHD ATMOS', 'DOLBY MAT ATMOS', 'DOLBY AC4 ATMOS'

supportedVideoFormat.summary: A list of supported Video formats

audioPort1.summary: Audio port name (`HDMI0`, `SPEAKER0`, `SPDIF0`, and so on). The default port is `HDMI0` if no port is specified.

bassBoost.summary: Value between 0 and 100, where 0 means no bass boost (disabled) and 100 means max bass boost

boost.summary: Value between 0 and 96, where 0 means no boost and 96 means maximum boost

mode.summary: Enables or disables volume leveling (`0` = off, `1` = on, `2` = auto)

compressionLevel.summary: Value between 0 and 10, where 0 means no compression and 10 means maximum compression

connectedVideoDisplays.summary: A string [] of connected video display port names

dolbyVolumeMode.summary: Whether Dolby Volume mode is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`)

EDID.summary: A base64 encoded byte array string representing the EDID

enhancerlevel.summary: Value between 0 and 16, where 0 means no enhancement and 16 means maximum enhancement

gain.summary: Value between -2080 and 480, where -2080 means negative gain and 480 means maximum gain

level.summary: Value between 0 and 10, where 0 means no level and 10 means maximum level

MISteeringEnable.summary: Whether Media Intelligence Steering is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`)

ms12AudioProfile.summary: An MS12 audio profile name from `getSupportedMS12AudioProfile`

soundMode.summary: Sound mode. Possible values: `AUTO (Dolby Digital Plus)`, `AUTO (Dolby Digital 5.1)`, `AUTO (Stereo)`, `MONO`, `STEREO`, `SURROUND`, PASSTHRU.

standards.summary: A string [] of HDR capabilities. Possible values: `none`, `HDR10`, `HDR10PLUS`, `Dolby Vision`, `Technicolor Prime`, `SDR`

surroundDecoderEnable.summary: Whether Surround Decoder is is enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`)

videoDisplay.summary: Video display port name. The default port is `HDMI0` if no port is specified

volumeLevel.summary: Value between 0 and 100, where 0 means no level and 100 means maximum level

currentAtmosCapability.summary: Atmos capability of the connected device, ATMOS_SUPPORTED, ATMOS_NOT_SUPPORTED

zoomSetting.summary: Zoom setting. Possible values: `FULL`,  `NONE,`  `Letterbox 16x9`, `Letterbox 14x9`, `CCO`, `PanScan`, `Letterbox 2.21 on 4x3`, `Letterbox 2.21 on 16x9`, `Platform`, `Zoom 16x9`, `Pillarbox 4x3`, `Widescreen 4x3`

ms12config.summary: Supported ms12 config by platforms, possible values, CONFIG_Z, CONFIG_X, CONFIG_Y, CONFIG_NONE

enableSurroundDecoder.summary: Enables or disables Surround Decoder capability. The Surround Decoder is an upmixer that takes stereo music content, or surround-encoded two-channel movie content, and creates a high-quality multichannel upmix. If the Surround Decoder is enabled, two-channel signals and 5.1-channel signals are upmixed to 5.1.2.

getActiveInput.summary: Returns `true` if the STB HDMI output is currently connected to the active input of the sink device (determined by `RxSense`).

activeInput.summary: `true`:  1. STB is connected to TV's active input 2. Unable to determine if STB is connected to the TV's active input or not (because STB does not support RxSense) ; `false`: 1.STB is not connected to TV's Active input 2. TV is off

getAudioDelay.summary: Returns the audio delay (in ms) on the selected audio port. If the `audioPort` argument is not specified, it will browse all ports (checking HDMI0 first). If there is no display connected, then it defaults to `HDMI0`.

getAudioDelayOffset.summary: Returns the audio delay offset (in ms) on the selected audio port. If the `audioPort` argument is not specified, it will browse all ports (checking HDMI0 first). If there is no display connected, then it defaults to `HDMI0`.

getAudioFormat.summary: Returns the currently set audio format.

getBassEnhancer.summary: Returns the current status of the Bass Enhancer settings.

enable.summary: `true` if Bass Enhancer is enabled, otherwise `false`

getConnectedAudioPorts.summary: Returns connected audio output ports (a subset of the ports supported on the device). For SPDIF supported platforms, SPDIF port is always considered connected. HDMI port may or may not be connected.

connectedAudioPorts.summary: A string [] of connected audio port names

colorDepth.summary: The color depth. The value that is returned from `dsGetCurrentOutputSettings`

getCurrentResolution.summary: Returns the current resolution on the selected video display port.

getDefaultResolution.summary: Gets the default resolution supported by the HDMI0 video output port.

defaultResolution.summary: Default resolution supported by the HDMI0 video output port

getDialogEnhancement.summary: Returns the current Dialog Enhancer level (port HDMI0).

enable.summary: `true` if Dialog Enhancer Mode is enabled, otherwise `false`

getDolbyVolumeMode.summary: Returns whether Dolby Volume mode is enabled or disabled (audio output port HDMI0).

getDRCMode.summary: Returns the current Dynamic Range Control mode.

DRCMode.summary: The DRC Mode value: either `line` or `RF`

getEnableAudioPort.summary: Returns the current status of the specified input audio port.

enable.summary: `true` if the audio port is enabled, otherwise `false`

setAssociatedAudioMixing.summary: Sets the Associated Audio Mixing Enable/Disable.

mixing.summary: `true` enables the Associated Audio Mixing for specified audio port. `false` to disables

getAssociatedAudioMixing.summary: Returns the Associated Audio Mixing status.

mixing.summary: `true` if Associated Audio Mixing enabled for the specified audio port, otherwise `false`.

setFaderControl.summary: Sets the set the mixerbalance betweeen main and associated audio.

mixerBalance.summary: Value between -32 to +32, where -32 means mute associated and +32 means mute main.

getFaderControl.summary: Returns the mixerbalance betweeen main and associated audio

mixerBalance.summary: Value between -32 to +32, where -32 means mute associated and +32 means mute main.

lang.summary: 3 letter lang code should be used as per ISO 639.
3 letter lang code should be used as per ISO 639.
3 letter lang code should be used as per ISO 639.
3 letter lang code should be used as per ISO 639.

getGraphicEqualizerMode.summary: Returns the current Graphic Equalizer Mode setting (port HDMI0).

enable.summary: `true` if Graphic Equalizer Mode is enabled, otherwise `false`

mode.summary: Graphic Equalizer mode (`0` = mode not set or in case of error, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

getIntelligentEqualizerMode.summary: Returns the current Intelligent Equalizer Mode setting (port HDMI0).

enable.summary: `true` if Intelligent Equalizer Mode is enabled, otherwise `false`

mode.summary: Intelligent Equalizer mode (`0` = off, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

getMISteering.summary: Returns the current status of Media Intelligence Steering settings.

getMS12AudioCompression.summary: Returns the current audio compression settings.

enable.summary: `true` if audio compression is enabled, otherwise `false`

getMS12AudioProfile.summary: Returns the current MS12 audio profile settings.

getMuted.summary: Returns whether audio is muted on a given port.

getPreferredColorDepth.summary: Returns the current color depth on the selected video display port.

getSettopAudioCapabilities.summary: Returns the set-top audio capabilities for the specified audio port.

AudioCapabilities.summary: An array of audio capabilities supported by STB

items.summary: Audio capability name (None in case of no audio capability support)

getSettopHDRSupport.summary: Returns an HDR support object (list of standards that the STB supports).

getSettopMS12Capabilities.summary: Returns the set-top MS12 audio capabilities for the specified audio port.

ms12Capabilities.summary: A string [] of MS12 audio capabilities

getSinkAtmosCapability.summary: Returns the ATMOS capability of the sink (HDMI0).

atmos_capability.summary: ATMOS Capability (`0` = off, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

getSoundMode.summary: Returns the sound mode for the incoming video display. If the argument is `Null` or empty (although not recommended), this returns the output mode of all connected ports, whichever is connected, while giving priority to the HDMI port. If the video display is not connected, then it returns `Stereo` as a safe default.

supportedAudioModes.summary: A string [] of supported audio modes

getSupportedAudioPorts.summary: Returns all audio ports supported on the device (all ports that are physically present).

supportedAudioPorts.summary: A string [] of supported audio ports

getSupportedMS12AudioProfiles.summary: Returns list of platform supported MS12 audio profiles for the specified audio port.

supportedMS12AudioProfiles.summary: A string [] of MS12 audio profiles

getSupportedResolutions.summary: Returns supported resolutions on the selected video display port (both TV and STB) by its name.

supportedResolutions.summary: A string array of supported resolutions on the selected video display port

supportedSettopResolutions.summary: A string array of supported STB resolutions

getSupportedTvResolutions.summary: Returns supported TV resolutions on the selected video display port.

supportedTvResolutions.summary: A string [] of supported TV resolutions

getSupportedVideoDisplays.summary: Returns all video ports supported on the device (all ports that are physically present).

supportedVideoDisplays.summary: a string [] of supported video display ports

getSurroundVirtualizer.summary: (Version 1) Returns the current surround virtualizer boost settings.

enable.summary: `true` if Surround Virtualizer is enabled, otherwise `false`

getSurroundVirtualizer.summary: (Version 2) Returns the current surround virtualizer boost settings.

getTVHDRCapabilities.summary:
Gets HDR capabilities supported by the TV. The following values (OR-ed value) are possible:  
* 0x0 - HDRSTANDARD_NONE  
* 0x1 - HDRSTANDARD_HDR10  
* 0x2 - HDRSTANDARD_HLG  
* 0x4 - HDRSTANDARD_DolbyVision  
* 0x8 - HDRSTANDARD_TechnicolorPrime. 
* 0x10 - HDRSTANDARD_HDR10PLUS  
* 0x20 - HDRSTANDARD_SDR

capabilities.summary: The OR-ed value of supported HDR standards by the TV

getTvHDRSupport.summary: Returns an HDR support object (list of standards that the TV supports).

getVideoFormat.summary: Returns the current and supported video formats.

getVideoPortStatusInStandby.summary: Returns video port status in standby mode (failure if the port name is missing).

videoPortStatusInStandby.summary: video port status (enabled/disabled) in standby mode in case of success

error_message.summary: Error message in case of failure

enable.summary: `true` if Volume Leveller is enabled, otherwise `false`

getVolumeLeveller.summary: (Version 2) Returns the current Volume Leveller setting.

isConnectedDeviceRepeater.summary: Indicates whether the device connected to the HDMI0 video output port is an HDCP repeater.

HdcpRepeater.summary: `true` if the device is an HDCP repeater otherwise `false`

isSurroundDecoderEnabled.summary: Returns the current status of Surround Decoder.

readEDID.summary: Reads the EDID from the connected HDMI (output) device. Returns a key of `EDID` with a value of the base64 encoded byte array string representing the EDID.

readHostEDID.summary: Reads the EDID of the host. Returns a key of `EDID` with a value of the base64 encoded raw byte array string representing the EDID.

resetBassEnhancer.summary: Resets the dialog enhancer level to its default bassboost value.

resetDialogEnhancement.summary: Resets the dialog enhancer level to its default enhancer level.

resetSurroundVirtualizer.summary: Resets the surround virtualizer to its default boost value.

resetVolumeLeveller.summary: Resets the Volume Leveller level to default volume value.

setAudioAtmosOutputMode.summary: Sets ATMOS audio output mode (on HDMI0).

enable.summary: enable or disable ATMOS audio output mode

setAudioDelay.summary: Sets the audio delay (in ms) on the selected audio port. If the `audioPort` argument is not specified, it will browse all ports (checking HDMI0 first). If there is no display connected, then it defaults to `HDMI0`.

setAudioDelayOffset.summary: Sets the audio delay offset (in ms) on the selected audio port. If the `audioPort` argument is not specified, it will browse all ports (checking HDMI0 first). If there is no display connected, then it defaults to `HDMI0`.

setBassEnhancer.summary: Sets the Bass Enhancer. Bass Enhancer provides the consumer a single control to apply a fixed bass boost to correct for a lack of bass reproduction in the playback system.

events.resolutionPreChange: Triggered when the resolution of the video display is about to change.
events.resolutionChanged: Triggered when the resolution is changed by the user and returns the current resolution.

ignoreEdid.summary: Ignore the supported resolutions as transmitted by the connected TV EDID

setDialogEnhancement.summary: Sets the Dialog Enhancer level.A dialog enhancer boosts the speech audio separately from other background content, without increasing the loudness.The method fails if no value is set.

setDolbyVolumeMode.summary: Enables or disables Dolby Volume mode on audio track (audio output port HDMI0).

setDRCMode.summary: Sets the Dynamic Range Control (DRC) setting. DRC is a compression control applied to audio to limit the dynamic range to suit a specific listening situation. For default settings, RF mode is preferred for two-channel outputs (television speaker or headphone) and Line mode for multichannel outputs.

DRCMode.summary: Value of 0 or 1, where 0 is Line mode and 1 is RF mode

setEnableAudioPort.summary: Enable or disable the specified audio port based on the input audio port name. This feature provides the consumer with a single user control to enable or disable the specified audio port.

enable.summary: `true` enables the specified audio port. `false` disables the specified audio port.

setForceHDRMode.summary: Enables or disables the force HDR mode. If enabled, the HDR format that is currently configured on the device is used.

hdr_mode.summary: `true` to force the HDR format or `false` to reset the mode to the default.

setGain.summary: Adjusts the gain on a specific port.

setGraphicEqualizerMode.summary: Sets the Graphic Equalizer Mode. The Graphic Equalizer is a multi-band equalizer that allows the end user to customize the sonic qualities of the system.

graphicEqualizerMode.summary: Graphic Equalizer mode (`0` = off, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

setIntelligentEqualizerMode.summary: Sets the Intelligent Equalizer Mode (port HDMI0). An Intelligent Equalizer continuously monitors the audio spectrum and adjusts its equalization filter to transform the original audio tone into desired tone.

intelligentEqualizerMode.summary: Intelligent Equalizer mode (`0` = unset, `1` = open, `2` = rich, `3` = focused)

setMISteering.summary: Enables or Disables Media Intelligent Steering. Media Intelligence analyzes audio content and steers the Volume Leveler, the Dialogue Enhancer, the Intelligent Equalizer, and the Speaker Virtualizer, based on the type of audio content.

setMS12AudioCompression.summary: Sets the audio dynamic range compression level (port HDMI0).

setMS12AudioProfile.summary: Sets the selected MS12 audio profile.

setMS12ProfileSettingsOverride.summary: Overrides individual MS12 audio settings in order to optimize the customer experience (for example, enabling dialog enhancement in sports mode)

profileName.summary: An MS12 audio profile name from `getSupportedMS12AudioProfile`

setMuted.summary: Mutes or unmutes audio on a specific port.

events.muteStatusChanged: Triggered when the mute status changed.

setPreferredColorDepth.summary: Sets the current color depth for the videoDisplay.

setScartParameter.summary:
Sets SCART parameters.  
   
Possible values:  
| **Parameter** | **ParameterData** |  
| `aspect_ratio` | `4x3` or `16x9` |  
| `tv_startup` | `on` or `off` |  
| `rgb` | `on` (disables cvbs) |  
| `cvbs` | `on` (disables rgb) |  
| `macrovision` | not implemented |  
| `cgms` |  `disabled`, `copyNever`, `copyOnce`, `copyFreely`, or `copyNoMore` |  
| `port` | `on` or `off` |

setSoundMode.summary: Sets the current sound mode for the corresponding video display. If the `audioPort` argument value is missing or empty all ports are set.

setSurroundVirtualizer.summary: (Version 1)Sets the Surround Virtualizer boost. The Speaker/Surround Virtualizer enables a surround sound signal (including one generated by the Surround Decoder) to be rendered over a device with built-in speakers or headphones.

(Version 2) Sets the Surround Virtualizer boost. The Speaker/Surround Virtualizer enables a surround sound signal (including one generated by the Surround Decoder) to be rendered over a device with built-in speakers or headphones.

setVideoPortStatusInStandby.summary: Sets the specified video port status to be used in standby mode (failure if the port name is missing).

enabled.summary: Enable video port status to be used in standby mode

error_message.summary: Error message in case of failure

setVolumeLevel.summary: Adjusts the Volume Level on a specific port.

events.volumeLevelChanged: Triggered when the volume level changed.

setVolumeLeveller.summary: (Version 1)Sets the Volume Leveller level. Volume Leveller is an advanced volume-control solution that maintains consistent playback levels for content from different sources.
(Version 2) Sets the Volume Leveller level. Volume Leveller is an advanced volume-control solution that maintains consistent playback levels for content from different sources.

events.zoomSettingUpdated: Triggered when the zoom setting changes and returns the zoom setting values for all video display types.

getColorDepthCapabilities.summary: A string array of supported STB color depth capabilities

getSupportedMS12Config.summary: Returns supported ms12 config by the platform, possible values couldbe CONFG_Z, CONFIG_X, CONFIG_Y, CONFIG_NONE

audioFormatChanged.summary: Triggered when the configured audio format changes

connectedAudioPortUpdated.summary: Triggered when the connected audio port is updated

HotpluggedAudioPort.summary: Audio port ID for which the connection status has changed. Possible audio port IDs are (`HDMI_ARC0`, `HEADPHONE0`,  etc).

isConnected.summary: Current connection status of the audio port

connectedVideoDisplaysUpdated.summary: Triggered when the connected video display is updated and returns the connected video displays.

resolutionChanged.summary: Triggered when the resolution is changed by the user and returns the current resolution

zoomSettingUpdated.summary: Triggered when the zoom setting changes and returns the zoom setting values for all video display types

videoFormatChanged.summary: Triggered when the video format of connected video port changes and returns the new video format along with other supported formats of that video port.

AtmosCapabilityChanged.summary: Triggered when the audio sink device Atmos capability is changed.

muteStatusChanged.summary: Triggered when the mute status changed.

volumeLevelChanged.summary: Triggered when the volume level changed.
